channel.title: Lipi
channel.description: most advance knowledgebase WordPress theme available on the market

wp:term.wp:term_description: Lipi - highly powerful Knowledge Base WordPress theme that guarantees less support email, a happy team, and loyal customers. Lipi is the best WordPress theme to handle support.

item.title: 1st Give Praise Post
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: I noticed that no-one has posted on the â€˜Give Praiseâ€™ section so thought I would be that person :). I only bought the â€˜Manualâ€™ theme yesterday, and really enjoying it. I have tried various plugins / themes for documentation / help guides / Knowledge Bases etc, but they donâ€™t seem to work seamlessly or provide the full functionality that I needed. So I was delighted to see that the â€˜Manualâ€™ theme was available, and this covers my requirements perfectly (and more).

item.title: Allow visitors to dismiss option slider
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Hello â€“ I think it would be really nice if website visitors could dismiss the optin slider after theyâ€™ve clicked it open. If there is already some way to set this option up, please let me know.
Thank you

item.title: Logo Adjustment
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Hi, BiND theme options: I made some tweaks using the â€˜Logo Adjustmentâ€™ see attached screenshots. The adjustments look fine on desktop display, but the â€˜adjustmentsâ€™ are being ignored on the mobile view. It appears the mobile view is retaining the default logo adjustment settings? My logo looks too small and poorly aligned on the mobile view How can I make adjustments (width padding) for the mobile logo? With thanks

item.title: Awesome Theme
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Hi,
iConsult theme options:
I made some tweaks using the â€˜Logo Adjustmentâ€™ see attached screenshots.
The adjustments look fine on desktop display, but the â€˜adjustmentsâ€™ are being ignored on the mobile view. It appears the mobile view is retaining the default logo adjustment settings? My logo looks too small and poorly aligned on the mobile view â€â€
How can I make adjustments (width padding) for the mobile logo?
With thanks

item.title: 404 page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Hi. I would like to override the function in the theme that displays a â€œ404 page not foundâ€ -error. I have tried using a dedicated plugin and have even edited the .htaccess file itself, but still it seems the theme setting â€œ404 Error Pageâ€ in the Manual Options overrides even this. Any suggestions on how I might achieve my goal?
